detaileddescription.para: Create a NoseHooverIntegrator. This version creates a bare velocity Verlet integrator with no thermostats; any thermostats should be added by calling addThermostat.

parameterdescription.para: the step size with which to integrate the system (in picoseconds)

memberdef.argsstring: (double temperature, double collisionFrequency, double stepSize, int chainLength=3, int numMTS=3, int numYoshidaSuzuki=3)
memberdef.name: NoseHooverIntegrator

detaileddescription.para: Create a NoseHooverIntegrator.

parameterdescription.para: the target temperature for the system (in Kelvin).
the frequency of the interaction with the heat bath (in inverse picoseconds).
the step size with which to integrate the system (in picoseconds)
the number of beads in the Nose-Hoover chain.
the number of step in the multiple time step chain propagation algorithm.
the number of terms in the Yoshida-Suzuki multi time step decomposition used in the chain propagation algorithm (must be 1, 3, or 5).

detaileddescription.para: Advance a simulation through time by taking a series of time steps.

parameterdescription.para: the number of time steps to take

memberdef.argsstring: (double temperature, double collisionFrequency, int chainLength, int numMTS, int numYoshidaSuzuki)
memberdef.name: addThermostat

detaileddescription.para: Add a simple Nose-Hoover Chain thermostat to control the temperature of the full system

parameterdescription.para: the target temperature for the system.
the frequency of the interaction with the heat bath (in 1/ps).
the number of beads in the Nose-Hoover chain
the number of step in the multiple time step chain propagation algorithm.
the number of terms in the Yoshida-Suzuki multi time step decomposition used in the chain propagation algorithm (must be 1, 3, or 5).

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< int > &thermostatedParticles, const std::vector< std::pair< int, int > > &thermostatedPairs, double temperature, double collisionFrequency, double relativeTemperature, double relativeCollisionFrequency, int chainLength=3, int numMTS=3, int numYoshidaSuzuki=3)
memberdef.name: addSubsystemThermostat

detaileddescription.para: Add a Nose-Hoover Chain thermostat to control the temperature of a collection of atoms and/or pairs of connected atoms within the full system. A list of atoms defining the atoms to be thermostated is provided and the thermostat will only control members of that list. Additionally a list of pairs of connected atoms may be provided; in this case both the center of mass absolute motion of each pair is controlled as well as their motion relative to each other, which is independently thermostated. If both the list of thermostated particles and thermostated pairs are empty all particles will be thermostated.

parameterdescription.para: list of particle ids to be thermostated.
a list of pairs of connected atoms whose absolute center of mass motion and motion relative to one another will be independently thermostated.
the target temperature for each pair's absolute of center of mass motion.
the frequency of the interaction with the heat bath for the pairs' center of mass motion (in 1/ps).
the target temperature for each pair's relative motion.
the frequency of the interaction with the heat bath for the pairs' relative motion (in 1/ps).
the number of beads in the Nose-Hoover chain.
the number of step in the multiple time step chain propagation algorithm.
the number of terms in the Yoshida-Suzuki multi time step decomposition used in the chain propagation algorithm (must be 1, 3, or 5).

detaileddescription.para: Get the temperature of the i-th chain for controling absolute particle motion (in Kelvin).

parameterdescription.para: the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: set the (absolute motion) temperature of the i-th chain.

parameterdescription.para: the temperature for the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (in Kelvin).
The id of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat for which the temperature is set (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: Get the temperature of the i-th chain for controling pairs' relative particle motion (in Kelvin).

parameterdescription.para: the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: set the (relative pair motion) temperature of the i-th chain.

parameterdescription.para: the temperature for the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (in Kelvin).
The id of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat for which the temperature is set (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: Get the collision frequency for absolute motion of the i-th chain (in 1/picosecond).

parameterdescription.para: the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: Set the collision frequency for absolute motion of the i-th chain.

parameterdescription.para: the collision frequency in picosecond.
the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: Get the collision frequency for pairs' relative motion of the i-th chain (in 1/picosecond).

parameterdescription.para: the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: Set the collision frequency for pairs' relative motion of the i-th chain.

parameterdescription.para: the collision frequency in picosecond.
the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: Compute the total (potential + kinetic) heat bath energy for all heat baths associated with this integrator, at the current time.
Get the number of Nose-Hoover chains registered with this integrator.
Get the NoseHooverChain thermostat

parameterdescription.para: the index of the Nose-Hoover chain thermostat (default=0).

detaileddescription.para: This will be called by the Context when the user modifies aspects of the context state, such as positions, velocities, or parameters. This gives the Integrator a chance to discard cached information. This is only called when the user modifies information using methods of the Context object. It is not called when a ForceImpl object modifies state information in its updateContextState() method (unless the ForceImpl calls a Context method to perform the modification).

parameterdescription.para: this specifies what aspect of the Context was changed

detaileddescription.para: Return false, if this integrator was set up with the 'default constructor' that thermostats the whole system, true otherwise. Required for serialization.
Gets the maximum distance (in nm) that a connected pair may stray from each other. If zero, there are no constraints on the intra-pair separation.

Sets the maximum distance (in nm) that a connected pair may stray from each other, implemented using a hard wall. If set to zero, the hard wall constraint is omited and the pairs are free to be separated by any distance.
Get a list of all individual atoms (i.e. not involved in a connected Drude-like pair) in the system.

memberdef.type: const std::vector< std::tuple< int, int, double > > &
memberdef.name: getAllThermostatedPairs

detaileddescription.para: Get a list of all connected Drude-like pairs, and their target relative temperature, in the system.
Advance any Nose-Hoover chains associated with this integrator and determine scale factor for the velocities.

parameterdescription.para: the {absolute, relative} kinetic energies of the system that the chain is thermostating
id of the Nose-Hoover-Chain

simplesect.para: the scale factor to be applied to the velocities of the particles thermostated by the chain.

detaileddescription.para: This will be called by the Context when it is created. It informs the Integrator of what context it will be integrating, and gives it a chance to do any necessary initialization. It will also get called again if the application calls reinitialize() on the Context.
Goes through the list of thermostats, sets the number of DOFs, and checks for errors in the thermostats.
This will be called by the Context when it is destroyed to let the Integrator do any necessary cleanup. It will also get called again if the application calls reinitialize() on the Context.
Get the names of all Kernels used by this Integrator.
Compute the kinetic energy of the system at the current time.
This is an Integrator which simulates a System using one or more Nose Hoover chain thermostats, using the velocity Verlet propagation algorithm.
